default: (a) a {@item shield|PHB} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon=sand|category=basic}
(a) a {@item component pouch|PHB} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|PHB} or {@item druidic focus|PHB}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB}

classFeature.name: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Hunter
entries: Hunters usually rely on their instincts, governed by Wisdom, their awareness of the world around them. But you may prefer that your Hunter gains an advantage through their wit and quick thinking, or their unbreakable resolve fueling their efforts.
If this is the case for your Hunter, you may prefer to use Intelligence or Charisma instead of Wisdom for your Hunter features. If you do so, make the following changes:

items: Features which specify your Wisdom modifier (such as Supreme Quarry) instead use the modifier of the chosen ability.
Your Hunter DC is calculated with that ability, instead of Wisdom.

classFeature.name: Instinct
entries: Hunters rely on their senses and instincts. You can apply yours more keenly than most creatures, granting you an edge in combat that you can exploit in various ways. Your Instinct recovers on a short rest.
You also have a Hunter's Die, which determines the damage or bonus granted by some of your features. This increases as you level up in this class as per the column in the Hunter table.

classFeature.name: Quarry
entries: A Hunter needs a target. Once per turn, you can spend one Instinct and a Bonus Action to designate a creature within 60 feet of you as your Quarry, the target of your hunt. The designation lasts for up to one hour, and when you hit that creature with an attack, you deal additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die of the same type as your weapon. You can have only one Quarry at a time.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Your skills as a warrior are commendable, and you gain a {@filter Fighting Style Feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace that Fighting Style feat with another.

classFeature.name: Keen Eye
entries: A gut instinct guides your senses. Whenever you make an ability check using {@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB}, you can spend one Instinct to add your Hunter's Die to the roll total.

classFeature.name: Tricks
entries: A Hunter is flexible, able to adapt their skillset to most threats. These Tricks are combat techniques, unique skills or benefits to your skills, or modifications to your defenses. They may be informed by your Hunting Grounds.

At 2nd level, you know 2 {@filter Tricks|optionalfeatures|feature type=HTR}, and learn more as indicated in the Tricks column of the Hunter table. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can change one Trick for another that you qualify for, represented by your preparations for the day ahead.

If a Trick has prerequisites, you must meet them to gain that Trick. You can gain a Trick at the same time you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class. If you lose the prerequisite for a Trick, for example you change one Trick that another depends on, you may replace it with another Trick for which you meet the prerequisite.

If a Trick grants or modifies an attack you cannot use more than one at a time. For example, if you use the Retaliate trick to strike back at a foe, you cannot use the Trip Attack Trick on that reliatory strike.
If a Trick requires a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier plus your Proficiency Bonus.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you distinguish yourself from other Hunters by calling on the skills developed in your Hunting Grounds, the place you honed your skills. Your Hunting Grounds grant you features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Lesser Quarry
entries: Choose one of the following benefits. When you designate your Quarry, you gain that benefit.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: You can mark your Quarry without being able to see them. You have advantage on any Wisdom or Intelligence checks made to find your Quarry or see through its illusions, and your quarry lasts up to eight hours.

entries.name: Cautious
entries: If your Quarry moves so that you are within its reach for a melee attack, you can use your Reaction to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Strategic
entries: You can use a Bonus Action to take the {@action Dash} action, but you must move towards your Quarry. You can use a Bonus Action to take the {@action Disengage} action, but you must leave your Quarry's reach when you do so.

classFeature.name: Offensive Hunter
entries: At 6th level, your skill as a Hunter have grown and you develop new techniques to fell larger foes or to cleave through their minions. Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Focused Assault
entries: You deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage when you attack a creature that is below its maximum hit points.

entries.name: Considered Strikes
entries: When you attack a creature, you can spend 1 Instinct to add your Hunter's Die to the attack roll. If the target is your Quarry, you can do so after the roll, otherwise you must do so before.

entries.name: Thin the Herd
entries: Once on each of your turns when you attack a creature, you can immediately make another attack against a different creature within 10 feet of the target that is within your reach or range.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 7th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter levels 12 and 16.

classFeature.name: Greater Quarry
entries: Choose one of the following benefits. When you designate your Quarry, you gain that benefit.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Your Quarry cannot {@condition Frighten} you.

entries.name: Cautious
entries: Your Quarry cannot {@condition Charm} you.

entries.name: Strategic
entries: You learn your Quarry's resistances, vulnerabilities or immunities to any damage or conditions.

classFeature.name: Defensive Hunter
entries: At 10th level, your skill as a Hunter have grown further and you develop new techniques to help you evade danger. Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Quickstep
entries: Creatures cannot make opportunity attacks against you.

entries.name: Pattern Recognition
entries: After a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to AC against all other attacks made by that creature until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Evasion
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 11th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Hunter level 16.

classFeature.name: Superior Quarry
entries: Choose one of the following benefits. When you designate your Quarry, you gain that benefit.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: When you hit your Quarry with an attack, its AC is reduced by 3 until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Cautious
entries: When your Quarry hits you with an attack, you can use your Reaction to halve the damage you take.

entries.name: Strategic
entries: When you attack your Quarry, you can instead end the Quarry and make an attack against every other creature of your choice within your reach (if you use a melee weapon), or within 10 feet of your quarry (if you use a ranged weapon).

classFeature.name: Refined Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws, and one of your choice of Charisma or Intelligence saving throws.

classFeature.name: Hunting Grounds Feature
entries: When you reach 15th level, you gain another feature from your Hunting Grounds.

classFeature.name: Supernatural Hunter
entries: Your skills as a Hunter grow again, to the extent that your abilities seem almost supernatural. Choose one of the following abilities, which you can use once per short rest:

entries.name: Vanish
entries: You can spend a Bonus Action to become Invisible until the end of your next turn. While invisible, you can pass through objects and creatures that you otherwise couldn't as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn within an object or creature's space, you take 3d10 force damage and are shunted to the nearest available space.

entries.name: Blur
entries: You double your movement speed this turn (no action required). The first time you take damage after this turn, any unspent movement is used to reduce that damage, spending 1 feet of unused movement for every 1 point of damage.

entries.name: Reaper
entries: As an Action, you can make a special attack which, if it kills a creature, allows you to make another attack. All of these attacks deal additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die.

classFeature.name: Supreme Quarry
entries: Choose one of the following benefits. When you designate your Quarry, you gain that benefit.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: Your attacks against your Quarry deal additional damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Cautious
entries: You have advantage on any saving throws you make against your Quarry and its effects.

entries.name: Strategic
entries: You force your Quarry's attention, protecting your allies. The first time each turn your Quarry targets one of your allies, that ally has resistance to any damage dealt and advantage on any saving throws it makes.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon Feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@filter feat|feats|} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Zenith
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and so does your Strength or Dexterity score (you choose), both up to a maximum of 30.

You can have up to two creatures as your Quarry at any one time, and when you mark one you can mark another at no cost. Choosing another Quarry only ends your previous Quarry if you would have more than two, in which case you choose which to end.
At this level, you also gain access to a unique and powerful Trick. Relentless, Cautious, or Strategic Hunter.

subclassFeature.name: Edge of the World
entries: Borderland Hunters walk on the borders of the Material Plane and its mirror, the Feywilds, stalking the creatures that live there. Living in shades of grey and dim light, they have mastered the borders and can briefly change where they reside, striking terror no matter where a creature escapes to.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the Borderland
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}
Your experience in dealing with creatures of the between-realm has given you skills related to reading intention and concealing your own.
You gain proficiency with the {@skill Insight|XPHB} and {@skill Deception|XPHB} skills.

subclassFeature.name: Border-world Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}
Ghosts don't have bodies, and fey are tricksy. Try the fancy fire.
When you damage your Quarry, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Shift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Borderland Hunter feature}

You can use a Bonus Action to shift into a state between the planes. While in this state, which lasts for one minute, you can move through other creatures freely. If you move through a creature this way, they take necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
If you end your turn in another creature's space, you are shunted harmlessly to the nearest available space. Ethereal Shift ends if you become {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} or die.
You can use this feature for free once per Short Rest, otherwise it costs 2 Instinct.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Borderland Hunter feature}
The skills you gained from the Borderlands have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in Insight and Deception.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Shift Improvement
entries: {@i 7th-level Borderland Hunter feature}
While using Ethereal Shift, you can cast Misty Step once on each of your turns (no spell slot required).

subclassFeature.name: Fae Tricks
entries: {@i 11th-level Borderland Hunter feature}

When a creature hits you with an attack, spell, or other effect while you are using Ethereal Shift, you can use a reaction to end Ethereal Shift and teleport up to 30 feet away, potentially causing the effect to miss.
Regardless of if you evade the effect, the attacking creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 4d8} psychic damage. This damage increases to {@dice 5d10} at level 15.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Step
entries: {@i 15th-level Borderland Hunter feature}
While using Ethereal Shift, you have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.

Additionally, the necrotic damage you deal by passing through a creature's space increases to two rolls of your Hunter's Die. When you cast Misty Step using Ethereal Shift, you can deal this damage to all creatures in a 5-foot line between the space you teleport from and your destination.

subclassFeature.name: Planeswalker
entries: Extraplanar Hunters walk the outer planes, dealing with Celestials, Demons and Aberrations alike. Time spent in these outer regions inevitably grants a taste of the power these creatures wield, which Extraplanar Hunters manipulate to their own end. They may protect other planes from these creatures, go on missions in these areas, or simply live their lives there.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the Outer Planes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
Your experience in the outer planes has taught you much about magic and the beliefs and mythologies of others.
You gain proficiency with the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} and {@skill Religion|XPHB} skills.

subclassFeature.name: Outer-planes Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
You gotta deal with a wide range of creatures in the outer planes, nothing works against all of them. So try to hit it where it hurts: right between the eyes.
When you damage your Quarry, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Gift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Your exposure to otherworldly magics has given you access to a pool of energy you can derive power from. It can hold a number of your Hunter's Die equal to your Proficiency Bonus and refills when you complete a Long Rest. Damaging your Quarry adds one Hunter's Die to the pool.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Ward
entries: {@i 3rd-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Pulling from the Psionic Powers of Aberrations, you can protect your allies. When an ally within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your Reaction to roll any number of dice from your Planar Gift, reducing the damage they take by the total rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
The skills you gained from the outer planes have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in Arcana and Religion.

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Dusting
entries: {@i 7th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can spend and roll one die from your Planar Gift to grant that many temporary hit points to yourself or a creature within 10 feet of you.
If you damage your Quarry, you can instead use the Hunter's Die rolled as part of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Edge
entries: {@i 11th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}

Once per turn, you can use a die from your Planar Gift to attempt to poison a creature when you hit them with a weapon attack. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} until the end of your next turn, and take necrotic damage equal to a roll of the Planar Gift die. They take half as much damage on a successful save.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Boon
entries: {@i 15th-level Extraplanar Hunter feature}
Your gifts from the outer planes have grown in power:

items: Aberrant Ward now pushes the attacking creature 10 feet away from the ally you protect with it.
Celestial Dusting can also be used to restore hit points to a creature, and its range is 30 feet.
Infernal Edge imposes disadvantage on the saving throw if your target is a Fiend, Celestial or Aberration.

subclassFeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: Those who hunt in this environment have a unique challenge. Finding one creature in a crowd, instead of a forest. Vertical, cramped terrain, with winding alleys and hidden paths. And a thousand places to disappear in plain sight. Urban Hunters cut through this noise, finding their marks and stopping them from getting away - if they ever saw you in the first place.

subclassFeature.name: Skills from the City
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
Your experience navigating the cities has taught you how to find secrets, and how to get your way.
You gain proficiency with the {@skill Investigation|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skills.

subclassFeature.name: Everyman Quarries
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
Poison isn't what it used to be, and if you're a good soul you'll be hunting assassins yourself. It's a rare citygoer who can resist something like this, though.
When you damage your Quarry, you can choose for the additional damage dealt by your Hunter's Die to be Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Crippling Attack
entries: {@i 3rd-level Urban Hunter feature}
The best way to hunt a creature is to prevent them getting away in the first place.

As a Bonus Action, you can spend one Instinct to make a special attack against a target. On hit, they take damage equal to your Hunter's Die and are {@condition Halted|Starlight} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Expert
entries: {@i 7th-level Urban Hunter feature}
Your city-life skills have improved. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in {@skill Investigation|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Seeker
entries: {@i 7th-level Urban Hunter feature}

You have a knack for finding people. You can spend one Instinct and an Action to sense the direction to a creature as per the {@spell Locate Creature|XPHB} spell. This lasts for ten minutes and does not require your {@status concentration|concentrating}.

subclassFeature.name: Silent Killer
entries: {@i 11th-level Urban Hunter feature}
You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.

While unseen by a creature, you can make a special attack against it as an Action. On hit, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition Silenced|Starlight} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} until the start of your next turn, and they take additional damage equal to your Hunter's Die.

subclassFeature.name: Opportunist
entries: {@i 15th-level Urban Hunter feature}
When you kill a creature, you become {@condition Invisible} until the start of your next turn. This invisibility ends if you make an attack or force another creature to make a saving throw.
Your Silent Killer special attack can be used in place of an attack, instead of as an Action.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Reactions
entries: When you roll initiative, you can spend one Instinct to roll your Hunter's Die and add it to the total. You can do so after the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Insight
entries: You have a knack for reading people and their intentions. You can spend one Instinct to add your Hunter's Die to any ability check you make using the {@skill Insight|XPHB} skill. You can do this after the roll, and if this turns the roll from a failure to a success, you regain the Instinct you spent.

optionalfeature.name: Bear It I
entries: You can spend a Bonus Action and one Instinct to gain temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die plus your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Honed Senses
entries: You have additional Instinct equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum gain of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Heavy Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Heavy Armour.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: You can attempt to trip a creature when you attack it. You can spend one Instinct when you make an attack to force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your Hunter DC, falling {@condition Prone|XPHB} if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Retaliate
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack, you can spend one Instinct and a Reaction to make an attack against that creature, adding your Hunter's Die to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Driving Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one Instinct to force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Dazzling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend two Instinct to force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Disoriented|Starlight}.

optionalfeature.name: Finder of Traps
entries: You can spend one Instinct and a Bonus Action to sense the location and purpose of any traps (and their triggers) within 60 feet of you.
A trap is any object or mechanism that was created or placed to cause damage or other danger. This could include spells, physical mechanisms, or even dangerous loopholes in a contract.

optionalfeature.name: Trapsetter
entries: At the start of each day, you can improvise {@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Acid|XPHB} or {@item Oil|XPHB}. You can {@action Utilize|XPHB} this improvised item with a Bonus Action instead of replacing an attack or using the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.
Once created, the item lasts for 24 hours or until you improvise another, which costs 10gp and takes ten minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Preparations
entries: You can plan ahead when you know what the day holds.

At the start of each day, you can prepare a number of special coatings equal to your Proficiency Bonus. These coatings provide a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deal 1d4 additional damage of a damage type of your choosing other than force or psychic.
You can apply these to an arrow or other weapon with no action cost, but only one can be used at a time. The coatings retain their potency for 24 hours or until used.

optionalfeature.name: Naturally Talented
entries: You gain proficiency in a Hunter skill you are not already proficient in (Athletics, Acrobatics, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, Survival), then you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one that you are proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: Trained in Darkness
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range is increased by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When you are hit by an attack, you can spend one Instinct and your reaction to reduce the damage by two rolls of your Hunter's Die plus your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Cleaving Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend two Instinct to make an additional attack against another creature within your reach. The damage of the attack is equal to a roll of your Hunter's Die plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), of the same type as the original weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Readied Strike
entries: When a creature enters your reach and you are holding a melee weapon, you can use your Reaction to make an attack against them, adding your Hunter's Die to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Environmental Conditioning
entries: Your exposure to a range of creatures and environments has taught you how to prepare for many a situation.
When you complete a short or long rest, you can choose to become resistant to one of fire, cold, acid, lightning or thunder damage.

optionalfeature.name: Highly Skilled
entries: You become proficient in two skills of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Stamina I
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Blow
entries: When you make an attack, you can spend one Instinct to attempt to impede your opponent's coordination.
On a hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition Staggered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sundering Blow
entries: When you make an attack, you can spend one Instinct to attempt to temporarily weaken your opponent's armour.
On a hit, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition Sundered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hampering Attack
entries: Your attacks are aimed such that they affect your opponent's movement. When you hit a creature with an attack, it becomes {@condition Hampered} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Pocket Sand
entries: Once per short rest, you can spend one Instinct and a Bonus Action to attempt to {@condition Blinded|XPHB|blind} a creature. Choose a creature within 5 feet of you. It must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctual Mark
entries: You can mark a creature as your Quarry without using your Bonus Action, but it costs 2 Instinct to mark a creature in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Sterner Stuff I
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on any saving throws made against the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Indefatigable I
entries: You can remove one level of exhaustion whenever you complete a Short Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Hunter I
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) check, you can spend one Instinct to add your Hunter's Die to the total.

optionalfeature.name: Sliding Attack
entries: You are especially manoeuvrable. You can use two Instinct and an Action to do a special {@action Dash|XPHB} which allows you to move through other creature's spaces and not provoke opportunity attacks. Once per turn, if you move through a creature's space as part of this, you can make one attack with advantage against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Power Attack
entries: When you make an attack against your Quarry, you can spend one Instinct to subtract your Proficiency Bonus from the attack roll, but add your Hunter's Die to the damage dealt if the attack hits.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Stride I
entries: Your movement is not impeded by difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Stamina II
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Naturally Gifted
entries: You gain proficiency in a Hunter skill you are not already proficient in (Athletics, Acrobatics, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, Survival), then you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one that you are proficient in.

optionalfeature.name: Reputation Preceding
entries: You can spend one Instinct to add your Hunter's Die to an ability check that uses the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} or {@skill Performance|XPHB} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Indefatigable II
entries: Once per turn when you regain hit points, including from rolling Hit Dice during a Short Rest, you can regain an additional amount equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bear It II
entries: When you use your Bear It Trick, the cost is reduced to one Instinct and you can choose to recover hit points instead of gaining temporary hit points.
If you gain hit points this way, you can gain more by spending more Instinct, adding the roll of one additional Hunter's Die for each Instinct you spend.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Stride II
entries: You gain the benefits of the {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB} spell whenever you are conscious.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend one Instinct to force it to make a Strength saving throw or let go of or drop an object of your choice that it is holding. The object lands in the creature's space if possible.

optionalfeature.name: Sterner Stuff II
entries: You have advantage on any saving throw against necrotic damage or the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Hunter II
entries: You are untraceable. You make no sound when Hiding and cannot be tracked or seen by Divination or other magic unless you choose to be.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Resilience
entries: Once per Short Rest when you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Hunter's Die.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: You have advantage on attacks against your Quarry.

optionalfeature.name: Cautious Hunter
entries: When an effect would reduce you to zero hit points, you can spend a Reaction and one Instinct to be reduced to one instead. Then roll your Hunter's Die four times, add your Wisdom modifier, and regain hit points equal to the total rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Strategic Hunter
entries: If you have used your Reaction, you can spend one Instinct to take another. You can use only one Reaction per triggering event.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of the Planes
entries: You are trained to protect yourself from supernatural effects. You cannot be possessed.
Additionally, you can spend 1 Instinct to reroll a saving throw against being {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. You must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Outer Planes
entries: You feel most comfortable when things are strange. In environments on other planes, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, difficult terrain does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any environment, and while tracking other creatures you can learn their number and when they last passed through the area.
Furthermore, you can spend one Instinct to roll your Hunter's Die to identify supernatural danger. If you roll 4 or higher, you learn if you are being watched and how.

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Defenses
entries: Your exposure to creatures from other planes has taught you how to resist their powers. When you complete a short or long rest, you can choose to become resistant to one of necrotic, radiant, or psychic damage until you next complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Strike
entries: When you hit an Aberration, Celestial or Fiend with an attack, you can attempt to drive them away. You can spend two Instinct to cast the {@spell Banishment|XPHB} spell on the target. Success or fail, the target takes additional damage equal to two rolls of your Hunter's Die.

optionalfeature.name: Attunement with the Planes
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast the {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} spell, targeting only the Upper or Lower planes, or the Material Plane. You do not require the material components.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of Ghosts
entries: Borderland Hunters can pursue their foes even as they step into or through the Ethereal Plane. When you hit a creature with an attack, it cannot change the plane that it is on (for example, the {@spell Blink|XPHB} or {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} spells) until the end of your next turn.
If you see a creature teleport, you can use your reaction to move up to your speed in pursuit of it.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: Borderlands
entries: You are experienced travelling the lands that border your own. When travelling through the Ethereal Plane or the Feywilds, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks, you cannot become lost, difficult terrain does not slow your travel, you can forage for food in any environment, and you have advantage on ability checks or saving throws made to see through illusions.
Furthermore, in the Ethereal Plane, any vertical movement does not impose a movement penalty.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Death
entries: While using Ethereal Shift, you can replace an attack you make with an attempt to {@condition Frightened|XPHB} a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, it becomes {@condition Frightened|XPHB} and takes 3 rolls of your Hunter's Die as damage on a failure. On a successful saving throw, it takes half as much damage and is not {@condition Frightened|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: Once per Short Rest, you can cast the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell on yourself as a Bonus Action. When cast this way, the spell lasts until the start of your next turn.
If you have already used this feature, you can use it again at the cost of 4 Instinct.

optionalfeature.name: Halfway There
entries: When an attack would reduce you to zero hit points, you can make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 5 plus the damage taken. On a success, you are reduced to one hit point instead of zero. You can do this once per Short Rest.
You have advantage on Death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter of People
entries: You are trained to find people, no matter where they are hiding. You can add your Hunter's Die to ability checks using the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Deception|XPHB} skills that are made to gain information from others.

optionalfeature.name: Favoured Terrain: City
entries: You do your best work where people are. In cities and other settlements, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks, you cannot become lost outside of magical means, difficult terrain does not slow your travel, and you can find enough food to eat no matter where you are.
Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks made to identify local customs and find secret or hidden pathways in the environment.

optionalfeature.name: Building Scaler
entries: You are practised climbing buildings and leaping between them. You have a climbing speed equal to your movement speed and your jump distance is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Dirty Fighting
entries: You can attempt to wrest a weapon from your opponent. In place of one attack, you can spend one Instinct to make a melee attack roll, which sets the DC for your opponent's Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check. If they fail, they let go of one item or object they are holding, which falls into their current space if applicable.

optionalfeature.name: Alpha Strike
entries: Once per Long Rest when you roll initiative, you can replace the result of your d20 roll with a 20.
When you do this, the first attack roll you make is also replaced with a 20.
